Description: Hat(?); fragmentary; Striped silk and linen cloth (a), two pieces sewn together and lined with plain linen (b), simple tabby weave; along two opposite sides, the main textile is turned over the lining and hemmed; the remains of gathering along one (of these) side(s). (a) ground dark blue with groups of narrow stripes in white, turquoise and dark brown (mainly perished). Warp: Z-twist silk and Z-spin linen, ca 70 ends/cm Weft: Z-spin linen, ca 27 picks/cm Sewing threads: linen Z-spun S-ply sewing threads; running stitch and hemming (b) four pieces undyed linen lining, simple tabby Warp: S-spun linen, ca 15 threads/cm Weft: Z-spun linen, ca 14 threads/cm Edges: hidden or fragmentary Sewing threads: linen Z-spun S-ply sewing threads; running stitch and hemming
Curator's comments: History of use: part of a garment, maybe a hat.
Condition: Fragmentary; decayed periphery; brown silk perished; lining fair.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
